alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 07 at 3:08AM PST until December 08 at 5:50PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Polk and Benton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especially when the Willamette River is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM PST Thursday the stage was 26.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning. River is likely to crest near 27.5 feet around noon today. This river will slowly recede tonight, dropping back below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM PST.
